sentence: Thank you for the opportunity to speak with you this afternoon.

sentence: From my many conversations with you, I have a sense of the challenges that you face regarding the changing regulatory landscape.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses challenges related to the changing regulatory landscape, without providing any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance towards monetary policy.

sentence: Against that backdrop, I appreciate the opportunity to speak at the First Friday Economic Outlook, at the start of a promising new year, and share my thoughts with you on two vitally important topics: how the Federal Reserve's monetary policy aims to increase the availability of credit to foster economic growth, and how we are tailoring our examination and supervision of community banks to ensure that we are not inadvertently constraining lending.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any specific information or implications regarding the stance of the Federal Reserve. It primarily focuses on the speaker's appreciation for the opportunity to speak and the topics they plan to discuss, without mentioning any hawkish, dovish, or neutral views.

sentence: I believe that examination and supervision of community banks is a timely and important topic.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the examination and supervision of community banks, which falls under the purview of regulatory bodies rather than directly impacting monetary policy.

sentence: Because, as I will discuss shortly, lending by community banks plays an important role in the ongoing economic recovery, especially by providing credit to small businesses.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the role of community banks in the economic recovery and credit provision to small businesses, without directly addressing the stance of monetary policy.

sentence: And it is absolutely critical that examination and supervision do not produce outcomes that are barriers to small business expansion.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the impact of examination and supervision on small business expansion, without directly addressing the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or monetary policy.

sentence: Unlike most other businesses, banks are subject to a system of examination and supervision, developed over the past century, that has particular and deliberate characteristics: regular on-site visits by specially trained examiners; exit meetings between examiners and bank senior management to explain examination findings; written examination reports with narratives and metrics describing the findings of the examiners; and, if necessary, follow-up on action items that the bank must pursue to remedy specific problems.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the examination and supervision system for banks, which does not directly impact the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: The ultimate focus of examination and supervision is the safety and soundness of the bank, as well as compliance with laws and an assessment of the bank's ability to withstand risks and shocks.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it primarily discusses the focus of examination and supervision on the safety and soundness of banks, compliance with laws, and assessing their ability to withstand risks and shocks. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Community bankers are very much accustomed to opening their doors to examiners for their on-site visits.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it pertains to the practices of community bankers and their interactions with examiners during on-site visits. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: I'm not sure if James Anthony made it here today from his bank in Chestertown, but I want to share with you two memorable conversations I had with James when I was the Maryland Commissioner of Financial Regulation.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses personal conversations and does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) on monetary policy.

sentence: In one conversation, James told me how he left the glamour and fast pace of being a management consultant in New York City to return to the relative peace and serenity and awesome natural beauty of the Eastern Shore to run Chesapeake Bank and Trust where, he said, he could awaken each morning to the sights and sounds of the swallows and geese on the bay.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC).

sentence: In the second memorable conversation, James told me that my examiners in their dark suits were not only taking up all the spaces in the bank parking lot and occupying all the booths in the diner, but they were also, in his words, "scaring the bejesus" out of the same swallows and geese alighting on the bay, not to mention some residents of Chestertown who were convinced by the arrival of the many dark suits that the bank was on the verge of collapse.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or the economy.

sentence: So from that point on, we implemented more "town-friendly" approaches to examining our banks, including less-formal dress guidelines and more gentle parking practices for our examiners.

sentence:
Monetary Policy and Credit Availability
       To gain some perspective on this issue, let's set aside for a moment the beautiful Eastern Shore and the examiners in their new business-casual attire, taking the bus to the banks, and approach examination and supervision from the perspective of monetary macroeconomics and the Federal Reserve's decisionmaking over the past several years.

sentence: As most of you know, the economy began slowing in late 2007 and early 2008 and turned sharply downward in the autumn of 2008 when the financial crisis intensified, resulting in the worst recession in many decades.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it provides historical context rather than indicating any current or future stance. It does not have any implications on whether the policy will be hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: In particular, the federal funds rate target, which stood at 5â1/4 percent in midâ2007, was subsequently reduced to a range of 0 to 1/4 percent by the end of 2008, and that target range has been maintained since then.

sentence: Given the magnitude of the financial crisis and its aftermath, the Federal Reserve clearly needed to provide additional monetary accommodation beyond simply keeping short-term interest rates close to zero.

sentence: Consequently, like a number of other major central banks around the world, the FOMC has been deploying unconventional policy tools to promote the economic recovery.

sentence: In particular, we have provided conditional forward guidance about the likely future path of the federal funds rate, and we have engaged in balance sheet operations that involve changes in the size and composition of our securities holdings.

sentence: Nonetheless, the latest Federal Reserve Senior Loan Officer Opinion Survey on Bank Lending Practices, which was taken in October, indicated that although domestic banks continued to ease standards on their commercial and industrial loans, the net fraction reporting easing on such loans to smaller firms (those with annual sales of less than $50 million) remained low.1 Moreover, in recent quarters the fraction easing standards for smaller firms generally has been below that for loans to large and middle-sized firms.

Supervision and Examination of Large and Community Banks

sentence: They are relatively diversified, but also tend to be more highly leveraged than smaller institutions, and often rely on more volatile wholesale funding.
reason: This sentence implies that larger institutions in the US tend to have a higher level of leverage and rely on volatile wholesale funding. This information is relevant to US monetary policy as it highlights potential risks in the financial system, which may influence a more dovish or neutral approach to monetary policy to mitigate these risks.

sentence:
These organizations often are tightly interconnected, raising the prospect that the failure of one institution could rapidly destabilize the wider financial system, giving rise to the "too-big-to-fail" problem.7  
    
       The characteristics of the largest commercial banks stand in contrast with those of community banks.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the characteristics of commercial banks and community banks, without directly addressing the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) or its implications on monetary policy.

sentence: To be clear, community banks are not immune from taking on excessive risk.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of the stance or implications on monetary policy. It discusses the risk-taking behavior of community banks, which is not directly related to the hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance of the Federal Reserve.

sentence: But there are reasons why risks at community banks are likely to be less dangerous to the financial system.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication or implications regarding the stance of monetary policy. It discusses the potential risks at community banks, but does not address the overall monetary policy stance, making it unrelated to the classification of hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: First, community banks generally are less complex and more easily understood.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the nature of community banks and does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: Second, community banks tend to be more traditional in approach.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the approach of community banks, which does not directly impact the overall stance of monetary policy. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: What is often referred to as "financial engineering" is less likely to become the norm in community banks because such engineering, by definition, may pose hidden risks that could reflect poorly on community bankers' judgment and negatively affect their image in the community if these risks are realized.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It implies that community banks are less likely to engage in financial engineering due to the potential risks involved, which could negatively impact their reputation. This cautious approach aligns with a dovish monetary policy that prioritizes stability and risk management.

sentence: Third, community banks are less interconnected, so when a community bank fails, the effects are less widespread.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the impact of community bank failures on interconnectedness, rather than addressing the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) towards monetary policy.

sentence: All of these characteristics have implications for how large and complex banks should be supervised, as compared with community banks.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the supervision of banks, which falls under regulatory policy rather than monetary policy. Therefore, it does not have any implications on the hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance of US monetary policy.

sentence: Notably, our supervision of large banks reflects the scope and complexity of their activities as well as their interactions with other firms and possible effects on financial markets, and incorporates systemic risk considerations that could arise from the failure of these banks.
reason: This sentence indicates that the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) considers the supervision of large banks crucial due to their potential impact on financial markets and systemic risk. It is relevant to US monetary policy as it emphasizes the need for a hawkish approach to ensure stability and mitigate potential risks.

sentence: This circumstance requires regulators to make capital, liquidity, and riskâmanagement standards more stringent for large banks than for community banks.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy as it emphasizes the need for regulators to impose stricter standards on large banks compared to community banks. This indicates a cautious approach towards risk management and implies a preference for tighter monetary control.

sentence: A critical part of this supervisory process is rigorous capital planning and stress testing to ensure that the largest institutions are capable of absorbing unforeseen shocks.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the supervisory process of capital planning and stress testing for large institutions, which does not directly impact the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: The Federal Reserve, for example, requires the largest top-tier bank holding companies to submit annual capital plans and conduct rigorous stress tests as part of the Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review exercise.8  In recognition of their systemic importance, the largest firms also are required to plan for their own orderly resolution in the event that they should fail.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the regulatory requirements imposed on top-tier bank holding companies. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance towards monetary policy.

sentence: Because of their complexity and risk characteristics, these firms require intensive and continuous on-site supervision; the Federal Reserve has dozens of full-time examiners on site at the largest banks to monitor their risk-management systems, strategies, and operations on an ongoing basis.
reason: This sentence implies a hawkish stance on US monetary policy as it highlights the need for intensive and continuous on-site supervision of large banks by the Federal Reserve. This indicates a cautious approach towards risk-management systems, suggesting a preference for tighter regulations and potentially higher interest rates.

sentence: In the years since the crisis began, our supervision of these firms has become arguably much more intensive, which I believe is perfectly appropriate given the effect that problems at the largest firms had on the financial system and the broader economy.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. The increased supervision of firms is seen as appropriate due to the impact their problems had on the financial system and economy, indicating a cautious approach to prevent future crises.

sentence: You may be asking, What does this have to do with community banks?
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses community banks, which is not directly related to the overall stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) on interest rates or monetary policy.

sentence: The community banking model is very different from that of the largest banks.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any direct implications on the stance of monetary policy. It discusses the differences between the community banking model and that of the largest banks, which is unrelated to the monetary policy's hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: Community banks are local by their very nature.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications regarding the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). It solely describes the nature of community banks being local.

sentence: This trait is particularly important when it comes to small business lending, where a local community bank may understand things about a prospective customer that cannot be captured in a more quantitative credit-scoring model that might be used by a larger institution.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the importance of a trait in small business lending, which does not directly impact the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: Risks at community banks tend to arise from their lending activities, whether in the form of credit or interest rate risk, and a lack of diversification can exacerbate these risks.
reason: This sentence suggests that the risks faced by community banks primarily stem from their lending activities and a lack of diversification can worsen these risks. It is relevant to US monetary policy as it highlights the importance of managing credit and interest rate risks. However, it does not directly indicate a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Unlike large, complex banks, community banks typically do not rely on their investment portfolios or diversified business lines to offset low profits.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of the stance or implications on monetary policy. It solely discusses the characteristics of community banks and their reliance on investment portfolios or diversified business lines.

sentence: All of these characteristics call for a very different model of examination and supervision than what is required for the largest banks.
reason: This sentence suggests that the mentioned characteristics require a distinct approach to examination and supervision, indicating a need for a different model. However, it does not directly relate to US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in terms of its implications on monetary policy.

sentence: Just as community banks have a deep understanding of their local communities, it is important that examiners also understand local market conditions to be able to put the bank's management and credit decisions in the proper context.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the importance of examiners understanding local market conditions and does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: For example, when I was commissioner here, there was an old joke among state examiners that you never dared set foot in a bank on the Eastern Shore if you didn't know the latest monthly count of blue crabs.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses a joke among state examiners about knowing the count of blue crabs. It does not provide any information or implications related to the monetary policy stance, making it unrelated to the terms hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: Strong lines of communication between examiners and community banks are vitally important.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication or implications regarding the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) towards interest rates or the economy. It focuses on the importance of communication between examiners and community banks, which is unrelated to monetary policy.

sentence: Examiners are only on site periodically at most community banks, so it is essential that when they are on site, they communicate clearly with management about supervisory concerns in order to help bankers make improvements as appropriate.9  Examiners need to listen carefully to management to understand their perspective where views may differ.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the communication between examiners and management at community banks. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: I also believe it is critically important for federal examiners to work closely with their state colleagues, especially since we have joint supervisory responsibility for state-chartered banks that are members of the Federal Reserve System.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the importance of collaboration between federal and state examiners in supervising state-chartered banks. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: When these working relationships are strong, the banks we jointly oversee receive supervisory messages that are consistent.
reason: This sentence suggests that when the working relationships between the FOMC and the banks it oversees are strong, the supervisory messages received by these banks are consistent. This implies a neutral impact on US monetary policy as it focuses on the effectiveness of communication and coordination, rather than expressing a hawkish or dovish stance.

sentence: Examiners and other supervisory staff are often key sources of information on regulatory developments between examinations.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it pertains to the role of examiners and supervisory staff in providing information on regulatory developments, which does not directly impact the stance of monetary policy.

sentence: We encourage our examiners to be responsive to questions from bankers and help banks understand new regulatory requirements, and they take this responsibility seriously.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it pertains to the responsibilities of examiners in the banking sector. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: One of the analogies that I began to use years ago--and that I've shared with many of you--is that the risk-management system of a healthy bank can be pictured as a series of concentric circles.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses an analogy about the risk-management system of a healthy bank, which does not directly relate to the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: The inner circles consist of the systems and functions that keep the bank healthy and allow it to meet the credit needs of its community while remaining financially sound and compliant with its legal and regulatory obligations.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the inner workings of a bank and its compliance with legal and regulatory obligations. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Moving outward, additional circles include processes and checks such as internal audit, executive management committees, risk-management and internal controls, and appropriate governance by the board of directors.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses processes and checks related to internal audit, executive management committees, risk-management, internal controls, and governance by the board of directors, which are not directly related to the monetary policy stance.

sentence: The outermost circle is effective supervision.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not mention any specific actions or implications related to interest rates, inflation, or economic conditions. It focuses on the concept of effective supervision, which is not directly related to the monetary policy stance of being hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: The critical element of this model is that problem identification is first and foremost the responsibility of the bank, while banking supervisors kick the tires of the bank's risk-management and internal control systems.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the responsibilities of banks and banking supervisors in risk management and internal control systems. It does not provide any implications on whether the monetary policy will be hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: The examiners are, in this sense, a last line of defense and do not substitute for a bank's own processes for risk identification and mitigation.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the role of examiners in risk identification and mitigation within banks, which does not directly impact the stance of monetary policy.

sentence: They are not a guarantee of the bank's ultimate success or failure.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication of the stance being hawkish, dovish, or neutral. It simply states that the mentioned factors are not determinants of the bank's ultimate success or failure.

sentence: While I think this model of concentric circles generally holds true for banks of all sizes, the complexity of the largest institutions requires far more complex inner circles.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the complexity of inner circles within banks, which does not directly relate to the monetary policy stance of being hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: Arguably, the financial crisis revealed that at many of the largest firms, the sophistication of these banks' governance, controls, and risk management did not keep pace with the rapid growth of risk.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the shortcomings of banks' governance and risk management during the financial crisis. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Moreover, because the potential cost of a breakdown at the largest firms includes losses that are external to the financial institution, it is essential that a strong outer circle of effective supervision be in place as an extra buffer to insulate other firms and taxpayers from systemic risk.
reason: This sentence emphasizes the importance of having a strong outer circle of effective supervision to protect other firms and taxpayers from systemic risk. It is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not directly address interest rates or the stance of monetary policy.

sentence: I would suggest that the outer circle that is necessary at a systemically important bank should be far more layered than what is needed at a small community bank.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the structure of bank regulation, which falls under the jurisdiction of financial regulatory authorities rather than the Federal Reserve. Therefore, it has no direct implications on the monetary policy stance, whether hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence:
Community Bank Supervision at the Federal Reserve
       One way we at the Federal Reserve are working to ensure that our supervisory program is properly tailored to the wide array of institutions we supervise is to review policies that are under development with an eye toward considering the effect that these policies might have on smaller institutions.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the Federal Reserve's efforts to tailor its supervisory program for community banks. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: In this regard, along with my colleague Governor Betsy Duke, I serve on a subcommittee of the Board that oversees the supervision of community and small regional banking organizations.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the role of the speaker and their colleague in overseeing community and small regional banking organizations, without providing any indication of their stance on interest rates or monetary policy.

sentence: Among other things, we consider not only whether specific policies are appropriate for community banks, but also whether these policies could have the effect of reducing the availability of credit to sound borrowers.
reason: This sentence suggests that the FOMC is taking into account the potential impact of specific policies on the availability of credit to sound borrowers, indicating a neutral stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: We are actively involved in providing greater clarity and specificity regarding the applicability of supervisory policies to community banks.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on providing clarity and specificity regarding supervisory policies for community banks, which does not directly impact the stance of monetary policy.

sentence: One of the things that I try to do whenever I review policies is to draw on my experience of working with community banks in Maryland and think about the effects these policies are likely to have on community banks and the areas they serve.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the personal experience of the speaker with community banks in Maryland. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance towards monetary policy.

sentence: Ideally, our supervisory policies result in stronger community banks that are able to lend and promote sustainable economic growth in their communities.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the impact of supervisory policies on community banks and their ability to promote economic growth, without directly addressing the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or monetary policy.

sentence: Let me conclude my remarks by again thanking you for the opportunity to share my thoughts today.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication or stance on the direction of interest rates or the economy. It is a closing statement expressing gratitude and does not reflect a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: I certainly don't claim to have all the answers when it comes to supervising community banks, but I hope my remarks will at least continue our conversation about how best to structure a regulatory and supervisory framework for the banking system that effectively supports the real economy and encourages sound and sustained lending to creditworthy borrowers.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on supervising community banks and structuring a regulatory framework for the banking system. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: In order to sustain the economic recovery, we need strong, well-run community banks that operate in a framework of smart and effective supervision.

sentence: I commend you for the work that you are doing every day in your communities, and I look forward to continuing the dialogue.
